title: Phase 2B: OpenClaw extras tool providers (web-only)
description: Implement non-browser OpenClaw extra tool providers with dynamic loading, keep web-only channel scope, and preserve current core tool behavior.
acceptance_criteria: Provider framework stable; first extra provider shipped; live tests green; docs updated

title: Implement openclaw_sessions provider scaffold
description: Add dynamic provider openclaw_sessions with config gating, registration, and channel-aware loading for web.
acceptance_criteria: Provider visible only when enabled; no conflicts with core tools; channel gating tested

title: Implement sessions tools: sessions_list sessions_history sessions_send
description: Add concrete tool handlers under openclaw_sessions provider with structured envelopes and bounded outputs.
acceptance_criteria: All three tools callable; schema + happy/error paths covered

title: Add env-gated live tests for openclaw_sessions tools
description: Create live integration tests for sessions tools, matching existing HOMIE_LIVE_TESTS pattern.
acceptance_criteria: Tests skip cleanly when env unset; pass in configured env

title: Implement tool-output prompt window retention policy
description: Keep tool outputs in prompt context for last N turns only; preserve full outputs in storage for diagnostics.
acceptance_criteria: Context assembly respects N-turn window; no regression in thread replay

title: UI: render extra provider tool results in chat turns
description: Ensure chat turns render openclaw extra tool outputs/errors with same envelope style as existing tools.
acceptance_criteria: Sessions tool responses readable in UI; no polling regressions

title: Plan next extras: canvas nodes cron
description: Define implementation order, contracts, and test matrix for openclaw_canvas, openclaw_nodes, openclaw_cron providers.
acceptance_criteria: Plan captured in phase2 docs with dependencies and acceptance gates

title: Phase 3: React Native (Expo) app - chat-first parity
description: Build a cross-platform mobile app using latest Expo/React Native with equivalent chat experience to web first, then terminal support. Keep protocol parity with chat.* and terminal.* from gateway.
notes: Plan doc: plans/phase2/rn-expo-chat-first.md. Chat-first ordering with deferred terminal renderer.

title: Bootstrap Expo app workspace under src/apps/mobile
description: Create new Expo app (latest stable SDK at implementation time), wire TypeScript, lint/typecheck, env handling, and gateway URL configuration. Add run scripts and developer docs.

title: Extract shared gateway/chat client package for web + mobile
description: Move protocol envelope, RPC client, event subscriptions, and chat API helpers into a shared TS package to avoid drift between web and mobile.

title: Implement chat thread list/detail + streaming turn rendering on RN
description: Render chat threads, open thread detail, subscribe to chat.* events, and stream assistant/tool/reasoning updates with web-equivalent UX semantics.

title: Build mobile app shell and gateway connection lifecycle
description: Implement RN navigation (chat-first), gateway target selection, connect/disconnect status, and reconnect handling equivalent to web behavior.

title: Implement RN composer parity: settings, tools list, approvals, queued inject
description: Port composer controls (model, effort, collaboration mode, permission), chat.tools.list display, approval prompts/actions, and mid-turn queued inject behavior.

title: Mobile chat persistence + reconnect semantics parity
description: Match web chat behavior for resume/reconnect, queued inject handling, active-turn indicators, optimistic UI rollback, and local draft persistence across app restarts.

title: Terminal on mobile: protocol scaffold and UX placeholder
description: Define RN terminal screen shell and protocol hooks (terminal.*) without renderer. Include navigation entry, capability gating, and explicit not-yet-supported UX state.

title: Add RN live integration tests against gateway chat providers
description: Add env-gated live tests/smoke for RN chat flows: connect, thread list/read, send, stream updates, approvals, tool rendering. Reuse existing live provider test toggles where possible.

title: Terminal renderer implementation plan (post-chat)
description: Research and select cross-platform terminal rendering strategy for RN (WebView xterm baseline vs native bridge), performance constraints, keyboard UX, and parity gaps. Produce implementation plan and acceptance gates.
